src/kernel/syscall.c

00001 /*! \file syscall.c
00002 
00003  This files holds the implementations of system calls.
00004  It is merged into the system_call_handler function in
00005  kernel.c through a pre-processor include.
00006 
00007  */
00008 
00009 case SYSCALL_PRINTS:
00010 {
00011  kprints((char*) (SYSCALL_ARGUMENTS.rdi));
00012  SYSCALL_ARGUMENTS.rax=ALL_OK;
00013  break;
00014 }
00015 
00016 case SYSCALL_PRINTHEX:
00017 {
00018  kprinthex(SYSCALL_ARGUMENTS.rdi);
00019  SYSCALL_ARGUMENTS.rax=ALL_OK;
00020  break;
00021 }
00022 
00023 case SYSCALL_DEBUGGER:
00024 {
00025  /* Enable the bochs iodevice and force a return to the debugger. */
00026  outw(0x8a00, 0x8a00);
00027  outw(0x8a00, 0x8ae0);
00028 
00029  SYSCALL_ARGUMENTS.rax=ALL_OK;
00030  break;
00031 }
